column4: Hi, may I ask the difference between Kubuntu, Ubuntu and Xubuntu?
All I know is Kubuntu uses KDE, Ubuntu uses GNOME, and Xubuntu uses Xfce.
in short: the base system will be exactly the same... so you will have the same software... it will jsut look different

xubunut uses xfce, the samllest and fastest of those you are mentioning. kde is know for being very complete and having a lot of settings you can change. gnome is generally know for being minimal and less  bulky tha KDE.
they are a bit more than that...
the menus will be organized in a different way
but you can test it... all the interfaces are just programms, like any other progrma to
you can easily install and uninstall them
so you can turn a ubuntu in a full xubuntu or kubuntu and vice versa
xfce is faster
i use fluxbox.. it is one of the fastest... but very minimal
fluxbox is not really for beginners... it makes a lot use of key short cuts
i barely use the mouse
maybe, if you are coming from gnome, xfce will be a good thing for you
wait...do you ahve ubuntu installed?
you can use gnome and xfce side by side and choose waht you like to use during log in
Thanks
you are welcome...
again, all things can be installed side by side... you can have fluxbox, xfce, gnome, kde installed in the same time and then choose what to use when you log in
i did that when i was looking for my favourite interface...
btw, if you are playing around... i REALLY, recommend you to have a look at gnome-do or kupfer
they are application starters and also index some of your most used files... gnome-do or kupfer make the use of menus obsolete and you will find your files very fast
there are youtube videos on how they work and what they can do
I'll look into those too, its good to learn more about linux. I've learnt much today. Thanks again. I'll be back after re-logging in :)
